alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne; Kimball (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 03 at 6:41PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Cheyenne, Kimball, southwestern Banner and eastern Laramie Counties through 630 PM MDT... At 540 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles northwest of Carpenter to near Westplains. Movement was north at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kimball, Pine Bluffs, Potter, Burns, Dix, Albin, Oliver Campground, Oliver Reservoir, Kimball Airport, Gun Barrel, Panorama Point and Bushnell. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 382 and 402. Interstate 80 in Nebraska between mile markers 1 and 41. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
